video.title: The Mind of a Chef
video.synopsis: Producer and narrator Anthony Bourdain explores the creative processes of international celebrity chefs to learn what fuels their culinary artistry.

episodes.synopsis: David Chang makes instant ramen dishes and tsukemen. He travels to Japan for a bowl of the original tsukemen and visits a noodle factory.
episodes.title: Noodle

episodes.synopsis: Explore David Chang's relationship to the pig. He travels to San Sebastian to discuss pork bushi, prepares pork belly and tonkotsu, and more.
episodes.title: Pig

episodes.synopsis: This episode explores David Chang's past: dishes from childhood, summer eating, his time in Japan and golf.
episodes.title: Memory

episodes.synopsis: Learn all about Spain's influence on David Chang's career. He visits with some of his idols and makes fideos, a salt cod omelet and a sponge cake.
episodes.title: Spain

episodes.synopsis: There's something rotten in David Chang's kitchen -- and that's a good thing: katsuibushi in Japan, XO sauce, rotten bananas and kimchi.
episodes.title: Rotten

episodes.synopsis: David Chang hangs out with one of his best friends, Rene Redzepi, who happens to be the world's top chef.
episodes.title: Rene

episodes.synopsis: Focusing on simple dishes, David Chang travels to Japan for some yakitori and high-end sushi, while his pal Daniel Patterson prepares beets.
episodes.title: Simple

episodes.synopsis: It's gluttonous goodness in this episode: over-the-top indulgence with a foie gras sandwich, whiskey tasting mayhem and Hot Brown served three ways.
episodes.title: Gluttony

episodes.synopsis: David Chang prepares eggs with his chef pals -- Wylie Dufresne, Daniel Patterson and Rene Redzepi -- and makes his Ko egg.
episodes.title: Chef

episodes.synopsis: David Chang travels from Tokyo to Kyoto to meet and eat with friends. He visits a street market in Tokyo and Michelin three-star restaurant Kikunoi.
episodes.title: Japan

episodes.synopsis: Enjoy this all-New York episode with the Torrisi boys, oysters, carrot dashi, farming, and visit a New Yorker in Tokyo whose ramen is wowing the city.
episodes.title: New York

episodes.synopsis: This episode explores the idea of fresh in the kitchen: instant broth, pea agnollini, fresh and aged steak and "ike jime.
episodes.title: Fresh

episodes.synopsis: Savor an entire episode devoted to soy. David Chang visits tofu and miso factories in Japan, chef Christina Tosi makes burnt miso apple pie, and more.
episodes.title: Soy

episodes.synopsis: David Chang's protégé Christina Tosi makes corn cookies three ways and her three-layered Arnold Palmer cake. Chef Burns makes ice cream.
episodes.title: Sweet Spot

episodes.synopsis: David Chang profiles regional barbecue in North Carolina, Texas and Kansas City and the otherworldly smoky bacon from Allen Benton in Tennessee.
episodes.title: Smoke

episodes.synopsis: David Chang cooks and goofs around with his friends Peter Meehan in Japan, and Laurent Gras, Sat Bains and Rene Redzepi in Copenhagen.
episodes.title: Buddies

episodes.synopsis: Sean explores some unique regional cuisines of the South. Chef John Currence makes tamales, and pastry chef Lisa Donavan makes a buttermilk pie.
episodes.title: Southerners

episodes.synopsis: Having spent time reviving lost seed crops of the South, Sean makes Jimmy Red Corn Grits and a Chestnut Bread and Red Sive bean salad.
episodes.title: Seeds

episodes.synopsis: Sean Brock visits Anson Mills, where Glenn Roberts is blazing a trail to reintroduce the world to the Carolina Rice Kitchen.
episodes.title: Rice

episodes.synopsis: Louisiana cuisine has heavily influenced chef Sean Brock, who heads to the swamps in search of bullfrogs and later cooks gumbo and shaved catfish.
episodes.title: Louisiana

episodes.synopsis: Sean explores the preservation techniques that are critical components to Southern culture: drying, salt curing, canning and fermentation.
episodes.title: Preserve

episodes.synopsis: Sean explores his roots, prepares a typical Appalachian dinner, cooks chicken and dumplings with his mom, and makes fried okra and country ham.
episodes.title: Roots

episodes.synopsis: Chef Sean Brock highlights both the people and food of the Low Country by preparing an epic outdoor feast on his friend's farm.
episodes.title: Low Country BBQ

episodes.synopsis: Chef Sean Brock travels to Senegal, where he explores the markets of Dakar and M'Bour and cooks the traditional Senegalese dish Thiebou Yapp.
episodes.title: Senegal

episodes.synopsis: Travel with chef April Bloomfield to London, where her cooking career began, as she prepares walnut tagliatelle, Scotch eggs and rabbit pie.
episodes.title: London

episodes.synopsis: This episode focuses on April's love of the sea, which is deep and fully realized.
episodes.title: Sea/Salt

episodes.synopsis: April heads to the spice shop to explore the origins of curry and England's versions of this historic cuisine.
episodes.title: Curry

episodes.synopsis: Chef April Bloomfield explains her deep love for Italian cuisine and its influence on her cooking.
episodes.title: Italian

episodes.synopsis: April revisits signature dishes of U.K. cuisine, including bangers and mash, fish 'n' chips, and pies, and reviews the nuances of high tea.
episodes.title: British Classics

episodes.synopsis: Travel to Cornwall with April, who visits farmer and chef Tom Adams on his pig farm and later makes her famous pig's foot for two.
episodes.title: Farmer

episodes.synopsis: Find out why "nasty bits" deserve to be on the kitchen table -- on the menu are bubble and squeak and pigskin pasta.
episodes.title: Leftovers

episodes.synopsis: This episode follows April Bloomfield as she wrestles with the tough questions every chef has to confront.
episodes.title: Restauranteur

episodes.synopsis: Sean Brock shares some of the secrets that have made him one of the world's top chefs, including techniques for virtually any type of cuisine.
episodes.title: Techniques: From the Kitchen of Sean Brock

episodes.synopsis: Join celebrity chef April Broomfield as she demonstrates indispensable tips for everyone from beginners to experts, no matter what's on the menu.
episodes.title: Techniques: From the Kitchen of April Bloomfield

episodes.synopsis: Ed revisits his childhood in East Brooklyn, where a diverse range of cultures gave rise to his unique culinary style.
episodes.title: Origin

episodes.synopsis: Ed creates a new American cuisine in a melting pot of flavors from diverse cultural backgrounds, and pursues local fare from Texas and Brooklyn.
episodes.title: American

episodes.synopsis: On a private island in the foothills of the Andes, Ed and a renowned local chef cook a fabulous feast using purely elemental tools -- smoke and fire.
episodes.title: Argentina

episodes.synopsis: Ed shares how living and working in the town he loves has inspired and changed him, allowing him the freedom to create something all his own.
episodes.title: Louisville

episodes.synopsis: Ed feasts in the Bluegrass State, enjoying country ham made from an old family recipe and a local treat featuring smoke and spoonbill caviar.
episodes.title: Kentucky

episodes.synopsis: Ed explores the way he and other chefs around the world who were raised near the 38th parallel share more than a geographical link.
episodes.title: Latitude

episodes.synopsis: Ed explores how cooking draws on traditions but continues to evolve, serving up time-honored and cutting-edge dishes and taking a look ahead.
episodes.title: Impermanence

episodes.synopsis: Ed and a group of "spirited" experts explore the virtues of bourbon, and Ed creates an exotic dish for bourbon-loving actress Aisha Tyler.
episodes.title: Bourbon

episodes.synopsis: Chef Magnus Nilsson demonstrates the methods that the people of Scandinavia have used to weather harsh seasons by aging and preserving foods.
episodes.title: Winter

episodes.synopsis: Magnus Nilsson explores Sweden's spring landscape for tender herbs and other ingredients that come to life under the midnight sun.
episodes.title: Spring

episodes.synopsis: Magnus illuminates how understanding the essence of each ingredient helps an idea evolve into a palate-pleasing dish.
episodes.title: Creation

episodes.synopsis: Ed joins Magnus Nilsson on his return to France, revisiting the people and places that inspired and helped shape the Swedish chef's culinary career.
episodes.title: France

episodes.synopsis: Magnus shares how he, like other chefs, learned much of his craft from those who raised him, and how traditions help carve out an identity.
episodes.title: Traditions

episodes.synopsis: Chef Magnus Nilsson demonstrates how the seasons influence his cooking style, which relies heavily on locally sourced ingredients.
episodes.title: Locality

episodes.synopsis: A journey with chef Magnus Nilsson offers a glimpse of northern Sweden as he investigates and takes note of local traditions.
episodes.title: Documentation

episodes.synopsis: Chef Magnus Nilsson and his staff provide a look at what an average day is like working at their renowned restaurant in northern Sweden.
episodes.title: Fäviken
